thread.section_title: Paul Scholes expects Manchester United to beat Arsenal and Liverpool to a Champions League spot – Metro
thread.title: Paul Scholes expects Manchester United to beat Arsenal and Liverpool to a Champions League spot
thread.title_full: Paul Scholes expects Manchester United to beat Arsenal and Liverpool to a Champions League spot

author: Coral Barry
title: Paul Scholes expects Manchester United to beat Arsenal and Liverpool to a Champions League spot
text:
Manchester United are four points off fourth place (Picture: Getty) Paul Scholes expects Manchester United to finish in the top four after a fantastic run of results in recent weeks.
Alexis Sanchez gives Chelsea major hope with latest interview on Arsenal future United currently sit in fifth with Arsenal in sixth and Liverpool occupying fourth spot, but Scholes believes his old side will beat their rivals to a Champions League place.
The Red Devils have not qualified for the Champions League since the 2014/15 season, but have two games in hand over Liverpool.
If United win those games they will swap places with the Reds and Scholes believes they are on track to do just that.
‘The chances are good and I expect them to finish fourth,’ said Scholes.
Manchester United fixtures West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sun 9 Apr
Anderlecht (A) – Thu 13 Apr
Chelsea (H) – Sun 16 Apr
Anderlecht (H) – Thu 20 Apr
Burnley (A) – Sun 23 Apr
Man City (A) – Thu 27 April
Swansea (H) – Sun 30 April
‘They have been on a fantastic run, without making much progress in the league.
‘I think [United’s season] has been alright.
‘There is a big period now, this will define how good the season has been.
‘They have got three tough away games.
United have two games in hand over Liverpool (Picture: Getty) More: Football Jose Mourinho speaks out over Man United's interest for 'absurd' £173m superstar 
Antonio Conte in disagreement with Chelsea's board over £70m transfer 
Ramos explains to La Liga star why he would be crazy to join Chelsea or Man Utd 
‘If they can get through that with five or six points, they have got a great chance of finishing in the top four.’
United have to travel to Manchester City , Arsenal and Tottenham before the end of the season.
The Red Devils are still to play ten league games with their first tough away game against City on April 29.
City are just a point ahead of Liverpool and could yet still have their place in the Champions League challenged by Arsenal, United or Liverpool.
